name: Typography Category Pairing
description: Font-size, line-height, and text-color tokens are organized into categories (display, copy, interface, mono). Mixing categories breaks the typographic system â€” e.g., using a display font-size with a copy line-height produces incorrect vertical rhythm.

display.description: Display typography for headlines, hero text, page titles

copy.description: Copy typography for body text, paragraphs, descriptions

interface.description: Interface typography for UI controls, buttons, form labels

mono.description: Monospace typography for code blocks, technical content

rule: When a component uses a font-size from one category, the corresponding line-height should come from the same category. Mixing --ks-font-size-display-l with --ks-line-height-copy-l produces incorrect vertical rhythm because display has tighter line-height (1.15 base) while copy uses wider line-height (1.5 base).
